title: TNF What's Lincoln Thinkin' - Seahawks vs. 49ers
text:
TNF What's Lincoln Thinkin' - Seahawks vs. 49ers 
By Matt Lincoln/CBS12In the early part of this decade, the Seahawks vs. the 49ers was the best rivalry in the NFL. But with Jim Harbaugh gone from San Francisco and the Seahawks reeling to start the year, there is a new feeling going into this game on Thursday night - the feeling that the loser of this game might be out of the playoff race.Both teams are 2-4 and looking up at the two other teams in the NFC West. This is not totally surprising for San Francisco - the Niners lost most of their defensive stars this offseason, and seem to be rebuilding much of that unit under first year head coach Jim Tomsula. But this is totally out of character for the reigning NFC Champions. The Seahawks have not had a healthy Marshawn Lynch for most of the season, but more striking has been the team's inability to secure leads in the fourth quarter, especially at home.They're on the road Thursday night though, and Russell Wilson and the rest of 'Hawks know, their slow start has to end this week, if they want to make their third straight Super Bowl.Kickoff in Santa Clara is 8:25pm, and you can watch the game on CBS12. TNF What's Lincoln Thinkin' - Seahawks vs. 49ers 
Thursday, October 22 2015, 01:19 AM EDT Sports News 
Last Update on October 22, 2015 04:52 GMT MLB-LCS 
CHICAGO (AP) -- With clinical efficiency, the New York Mets have swept the Chicago Cubs and are going to the World Series for the first time in 15 years. The Mets topped the Cubs 8-3 to finish a four-game sweep of the National League Championship Series in which they never trailed once in a game. 
They jumped ahead of the Cubs early in the finale.   Duda had five RBIs. 
NLCS MVP Daniel Murphy iced it by setting a major league record by hitting a home run in six straight postseason games -- a two-run shot in the eighth. 
Cubs starter Jason Hammel gave up five runs in his inning-and-a-third. The win went to Bartolo Colon, who took over when Mets rookie Steven Matz was pulled after four-and-two-thirds innings. Cubs' postseason futility continues for a franchise that has not won a World Series since 1908. The Cubs are 0-4 in league championship series. 
TORONTO   by   
Game 6 is Friday night -- David Price goes for Toronto against Yordano Ventura of the Royals. NHL-SCHEDULE 
UNDATED (AP)-- -- Claude Giroux's (zheh-ROOZ') second goal, on a power play 2:09 into overtime, rallied the Philadelphia Flyers to a 5-4 win over the Boston Bruins. The Flyers overcame a two-goal deficit in the third period before Giroux one-timed a shot past Tuukka (TOO'-kah) Rask from the left circle for the game-winner. 
The Bruins have lost their first four home games of the season. 
In other hockey: 
-- Edmonton beat Detroit 3-1. Connor McDavid, the No. 1 pick in this year's draft, scored his fourth goal of the season. 
-- The Carolina Hurricanes blanked Colorado 1-0 in overtime. Victor Rask scored in the extra period. Cam Ward gets the shutout with 24 saves. 
--     NHL-
